job_description: • Execute production operations according to defined procedures and ensure the integrity and quality of our products Ability to operate and maintain laboratory to clean room standards required in the production of Life Science products Process work orders accurately using an ERP system in a timely manner Maintenance of production batch records and good documentation under ISO requirement Accurate tracking of production data, test data and inventory Assembly of 10x consumables and finished goods both manually and using semi-automated packaging equipment Ability to set up and operate packaging equipment and handle simple troubleshooting Perform preventive maintenance on some lab equipment Provide feedback to improve process quality and efficiency Identify issues occurring in production labs and escalate issues to supervisor’s or MSE’s attention High school education / Associate Degree or above Strong team player and detail oriented Good communication skills Ability to read and understand SOPs and equipment user manual Ability to enter data into electronic tracking systems like Excel Ability to multi-task and prioritize work load to meet strict deadlines under supervision Good documentation skills and ability to write procedures and reports Desire to be part of a rapidly evolving organization and taking products and processes to the next level Ability to lift up to 15 pounds and potentially stand or sit for up to 3 hour increments Experience in automation and packaging of Life Science products, Food Packaging products or related field preferred Relevant experience in a production environment working with standard production control tools – ERP, inventory control, and work orders Experience training employees on production processes defined in production batch records and work instructions Experience writing and revising work instructions and production batch records Experienced in communicating and collaborating with production departments.

• A background in biology is not required, but curiosity and scientific interest is.
• Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, math, or scientific discipline and 2 years of software development OR 4 years of professional experience building software.
• Experience developing web applications in React and Redux.
• Experience with shipping and maintaining software.
• Strong understanding of computer science fundamentals (e.
• Data structures, space and time complexity) Deep understanding of testing, build, continuous integration, deployment & continuous monitoring.

• Experience in sample preparation for Single Cell assays: cell culture, tissue dissociation, enrichment, flow cytometry, nuclei isolation.
• Prior experience in customer-facing technical support roles.
• With >3 years of relevant experience.
• Strong background in troubleshooting experimental workflows in a laboratory setting.
• Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and interpersonal skills.
• Provide expert scientific guidance on the use and applications of 10x Genomics products.
• Deliver direct application support and troubleshooting assistance to customers and Field Applications Teams.
